{"step_by_step_thinking": "Adamantinoma is a rare bone tumor, usually occurring in the tibia and fibula. Osteogenic sarcoma is also a rare bone cancer, typically found in the knee and upper arm. Osteoclastoma, also known as giant cell tumor of bone, is again a rare tumor that usually occurs in the knee. Squamous cell carcinoma, however, is a common type of skin cancer that can also occur in various other organs, including the oral cavity. Therefore, among the given options, squamous cell carcinoma is the most likely to be the common lesion of the mandible.", "answer_choice": "C"}
